III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12206 Staff qualifications; volunteer,
Section contractors on central registry
Description • (2) A staff member must be of responsible character and
suitable and able to meet the needs of children and families
served by the agency.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Case Aide has inappropriate/intimate relationship with Father.
Foster Care Worker threatened mother with possible court
repercussions associated with visitation expectations.
Investigation
In the review of the case file, it was determined Youth A is the
half sibling of Youth B and Youth C. Youth A is not a foster child
and Youth A lives with Youth A's Mother. Youth A's Mother is a
nonrespondent parent in this case. Youth A, Youth B, and Youth
C have the same Father who is a respondent in this case due to a
domestic violence incident between Father and Youth B. Youth B
and Youth C have the same mother, but not the same mother as
Youth A.
Interviews:
I attempted to contact Mother by phone for additional information
on 07/28/2025, and twice on 09/30/2025 and left messages for
Mother to respond if any additional information was needed.
Mother responded on 10/06/2025 and was interviewed by phone
on 10/10/2025. Mother reported attorneys were involved and a
court hearing is scheduled for 10/29/2025 regarding Mother’s
court hearing testimony concerns.
I interviewed Chief Administrator by phone on 07/28/2025.
Chief Administrator denied Foster Care Worker had any kind of
relationship with Father outside of case management
responsibilities. I interviewed Chief Administrator by phone on
10/16/2025. Chief Administrator denied Case Aide had any kind
of relationship with Father outside of a professional relationship.
I interviewed Foster Care Worker by phone on 09/30/2025 and
Foster Care Worker denied any relationship with Father outside of
case management responsibilities. I interviewed Foster Care
Worker by phone on 10/15/2025. Foster Care Worker denied any
reason to believe there was/is an inappropriate relationship
between Father and Case Aide.
2

Foster Care Worker reported there were 3 court hearings. The
first court hearing involving Foster Care Worker was on
07/28/2025. Foster Care Worker stated attempts to communicate
with the mother of Youth A regarding visitation plans included
sending a visitation calendar to the mother by certified mail on
08/25, 08/30, 9/9, and 9/13/2025 that were all returned. Foster
Care Worker stated other means of attempted communication
included text messages, and emails. Foster Care Worker denied
threatening the mother of Youth A with repercussions other than
sharing the consequences/outcomes of not complying with the
protocols associated with the visitation plan.
I interviewed Case Aide by phone on 10/10/2025. Case Aide
denied any relationship other than a professional relationship with
Father. Case Aide stated Case Aide’s only responsibility for the
case is the supervision/monitoring of visits and Foster Care
Worker is responsible for communication with the parties
associated with the scheduling of visits.
I interviewed Father by phone on 09/30/2025 and 10/10/2025.
Father denied any relationship with Foster Care Worker or Case
Aide outside of fulfilling case management responsibilities.
I interviewed MDHHS Monitor by phone on 09/30/2025. MDHHS
Monitor denied Foster Care Worker had any relationship with
Father outside of case management responsibilities. I exchanged
text messages with MDHHS Monitor on 10/16/2025. MDHHS
Monitor reported absolutely no reason to believe Case Aide had
anything more than a professional relationship with Father.
Documents Reviewed:
I reviewed social work contacts and initial and updated service
plans. The updated service plans documented Parental Visitation
Plan as weekly, 2 hours, supervised and the Sibling Visitation
Plan as monthly, 3 hours. This is consistent with the verbal
statements reported in interviews.
The social work contacts were reviewed, and they were reflective
of the implementation of the plans. Foster Care Worker had at
least 25 documented social work contacts with Complainant from
04/19/2025 to 09/22/2025.
I reviewed the most recent court hearing documents dated
7/25/2025. The court hearing information indicated sibling visits
3

were occurring consistent with the law and MDHHS/agency has
discretion in the scheduling/monitoring of parental visitation.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance with the rule per interviews
that were completed. All the parties denied Father and Case Aide
had anything other than a professional relationship. Additionally,
no evidence was found to support Foster Care Worker lied or
threaten Mother.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
10/16/2025
